member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.AbstractNativePreviewFileWriter
member.summary:
Abstract base class that can be used to build native preview file writers.
This class is derived from but also adds a property that can be set in the filter definition's preview writer section to automatically map file extensions so that the preview file can be viewed in varions preview applications.

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.AbstractNativePreviewFileWriter.ExtensionMaps
member.summary: A list of filter extensions that need to be mapped to other extensions before previewing. For example mappping .csv to .csv.txt files so they can be previewed in an IE browser control.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.AbstractNativePreviewFileWriter.GetProposedOutputFileInfo(Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.NativeApi.IPersistentFileConversionProperties,Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.NativeApi.IOutputFileInfo)
member.summary: Propose a filename based on origianl file path but with the file extension mapped to a new file extension if a map is found in .

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.GenericInternalWebBrowserPreviewControl
member.summary:
This class can be used to preview a single source or target file in a WebBrowser control.
The GenericSideBySideWebBrowserPreviewControl can be used to preview the source and target file in two System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser controls.

member.summary: Called to initially display or refresh the display of a single page in a System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser control. If both source and target files exist then only the target file will be displayed. The GenericSideBySideWebBrowserPreviewControl can be used to display both source and target files in two WebBrowser controls.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.MsOfficeExternalPreviewApplication
member.summary: Microsoft Office applications try to manage resources, processes on its own, so Process.Start() will return valid process id only if there are no other instances of MS office running. In other case Process.Start() call will return immediately without returning valid process id, because existing instance of MS office application will take over process creation and opening the file. To avoid this, special DDE switch has to be passed to MS Office application when it is started. Class below customizes starting of MS Office application. see: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/210565 for command line switch and see: http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/hu-HU/csharpgeneral/thread/21014f97-1732-4261-afe5-2127b2e64f68 for

member.name: F:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.MsOfficeExternalPreviewApplication.ShellCommandRelativePath
member.summary: Relative path in system registry to key describing default command for file extension

member.name: F:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.MsOfficeExternalPreviewApplication.AnchorText
member.summary: Text used to locate program path in command string

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.MsOfficeExternalPreviewApplication.DdeSwitch
member.summary: Gets or sets dde switch allowing to open every file in separate instance of MS Office Application directly.

member.summary: Get default shell command for extension

member.summary: Start external application for given file
member.param: File desriptor to open with application

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.TempFileUtils
member.summary: Namespace for methods that have to do with temporary file manipulations.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.PreviewControls.TempFileUtils.GetModifiedTempFilePath(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Construct a temp file name based on an original file name (which may include a path). This can optionally be done using a list of file extension mappings given in extensionMaps parameter.

param.name: extensionMaps
param.para: A list of file extension maps that can be used to map the original filename extension to a new file extension that can be used for previews.

Each string in the extensionMaps array can either be in two formats. This first is the original file extension followed by '|' and then the new file extension that will be used for a preview. This will generate preview files using the second extension for all previews of file with the original file that matches first extension. E.g.
".txt | .htm"
Will preview all .txt files by generating the a temp file using the .htm extension.

The second format that can be used for a string in the extensionMaps array is simply the file extension to be used for the preview and all original file extensions will be previewed using this preview file extension. E.g.
".html"

member.param: The original file path of the file being previewed.
member.returns: A tempoary file name that can be used to generate a preview.
